intro: Chamaemelum cota, commonly known as sweet William, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features linear, gray-green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Sweet William is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
